Course Description: THIS COURSE USES ACCOUNTING INFORMATION FOR PLANNING, CONTROL AND DECISION MAKING TECHNIQUES AND CAPITAL DECISIONS.  IT INCLUDES PRINCIPLES OF PRODUCT COSTING, BUDGETING TECHNIQUES, AND CAPITAL DECISIONS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
MAJOR LEARNING OBJECTIVES
TO PROVIDE THE STUDENT WITH A BASIC UNDERSTANDING OF INTERNAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS USED BY MANAGERS IN THEIR ROLES AS PLANNERS, CONTROLLERS AND DECISION MAKERS.  THE COURSE PROVIDES THE STUDENT WITH A COMPREHENSION OF THE IMPORTANCE OF THE ACCOUNTANTS CONTRIBUTION TO THE INTERNAL OPERATION OF THE BUSINESS.
THE STUDENT WHO COMPLETES THE COURSE WILL BE WELL PREPARED TO PURSUE ADDITIONAL ACCOUNTING STUDIES IN A FOUR-YEAR ACADEMIC SETTING.
COURSE CONTENT - TOPICAL OUTLINE 
MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING IS DESIGNED TO DEVELOP THE STUDENTS QUANTITATIVE AND ANALYTICAL SKILLS.  THE SUBJECT MATTER IS NOT SUBJECT TO THE RIGID GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES.  FLEXIBILITY AND INFORMALITY IN USING ACCOUNTING DATA TO ASSIST MANAGEMENTS DECISION MAKING IS EMPHASIZED.
INTENDED OUTCOMES
STUDENT COMPLETING THIS COURSE WILL BE ABLE TO:
1.DISTINGUISH THE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE VARIOUS TYPES OF COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE MANUFACTURING ENTERPRISE (I.E.) DIRECT, FIXED, INDIRECT, OPPORTUNITY, RELEVANT, SEMI-VARIABLE, SUNK AND VARIABLE.
2.CALCULATE PRODUCTION COSTS USING JOB ORDER COSTING, PROCESS COSTING, VARIABLE COSTING, AND CONTRIBUTION APPROACH COSTING.
3.DISCERN THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOW
4.UNDERSTAND AND PREPARE THE VARIOUS OPERATING BUDGETS
5.ANALYZE THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CALCULATE THE VARIOUS RATES OF SOLVENCY
6.APPLY COST-VOLUME-PROFIT RELATIONSHIPS SUCH AS:  BREAK-EVEN COMPUTATIONS, OPERATING LANGUAGE, CONTRIBUTION MARGIN AND TARGET NET PROFIT ANALYSIS
7.MASTER THE TECHNIQUES OF CAPITAL BUDGETING DECISION:  USING DISCOUNTED CASH FLOWS AND NET PRESENT VALUE TO DETERMINE THE MOST DESIRABLE INVESTMENT ALTERNATIVE
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
